channel.title: Times of India
channel.description: The Times of India: Breaking news, views, reviews, cricket from across India

item.title: 2 Army officers thrashed, their female friend gang-raped in Madhya Pradesh
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Centre seeks review of SC's mineral royalty judgment
item.description: The Centre has requested a review of a Supreme Court decision permitting states to levy royalties and taxes on extracted minerals and mineral-bearing land. This could result in a financial burden of up to Rs 1.5 lakh crore for PSUs and private industries. Madhya Pradesh joins as co-petitioner, citing public interest concerns.
item.dc:creator: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA

item.title: IIT-Guwahati academic affairs dean quits amid stir over student suicide'
item.dc:creator: KANGKAN KALITA AND ARVIND CHAUHAN

item.title: ODI World Cup 2023 boosts India's economy by Rs 11,637 crore: ICC
item.description: The ICC Men's ODI World Cup 2023 significantly impacted India's economy with a contribution of USD 1.39 billion, driven by tourism and media exposure. The event drew record crowds and created thousands of jobs, highlighting India's potential as a premier host for global sports events. The World Cup is expected to have long-term benefits too.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: PM Modi sets target of $500 billion for electronics production in next 6 years
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set an ambitious goal of tripling India's electronics manufacturing to $500 billion in six years. At SEMICON India 2024, he emphasized India's aim to become a global semiconductor leader with significant investments. Modi also pointed out growing partnerships with Japan, Singapore, and the US in this sector.
item.dc:creator: PANKAJ DOVAL

item.title: Apple iPhone 16 vs iPhone 15: Which iPhone to buy and why
item.description: Apple's latest iPhone 16 features notable upgrades over the iPhone 15, including a powerful A18 chip, advanced AI capabilities, enhanced camera functions with macro photography support, and new buttons for added functionality. It also offers improved battery life and faster MagSafe charging. Despite these advancements, the iPhone 15 is still a strong option at a reduced price.
item.dc:creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: Why Biden wore a 'Trump 2024 hat' at the 9/11 memorial event
item.description: President Joe Biden was seen wearing a 'Trump 2024' hat during a private gathering in Shanksville, Pennsylvania. The photo quickly went viral and elicited mixed reactions on social media. Biden wore the hat briefly at the request of a Trump supporter while discussing bipartisan unity during a 9/11 memorial event.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Caste census not 'Mandal vs kamandal' issue: Rahul Gandhi
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: 'He slapped me': Argentina goalkeeper assaults a cameraman - Watch
item.description: After Argentina's 1-2 loss to Colombia in a FIFA World Cup qualifier on Tuesday, goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez is accused of slapping a TV cameraman in Barranquilla. The cameraman claims Martínez hit his camera while he was filming. Colombia’s sports journalists’ association has requested FIFA to take disciplinary action against Martínez.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: iPhone 16 series: Specifications, price in India, and how to pre-order
item.description: Apple has unveiled its iPhone 16 series comprising four models: iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The phones feature a new Camera Control button and Apple Intelligence with iOS18. Prices in India start at Rs 79,900 for the base model and go up to Rs 1,84,900 for the top-end variant.
item.dc:creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: 1st T20I: Head, Zampa star as Australia beat England by 28 runs
item.description: Australia triumphed over England by 28 runs in the first T20 international at Southampton. Travis Head’s aggressive innings of 59 off just 23 balls set the tone for Australia’s total of 179. Adam Zampa’s economical spell and timely wickets from Josh Hazlewood restricted England to 151 all out, despite a brief fightback from Liam Livingstone and Sam Curran.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: Congress names 40 more candidates, Surjewala son gets Kaithal ticket
item.dc:creator: AJAY SURA

item.title: North Korea fires ballistic missile into eastern waters, South Korea says
item.description: On Thursday, South Korea's military reported that North Korea launched an unidentified missile off its east coast. This event follows a similar incident in May when North Korea fired an unidentified ballistic missile into the East Sea, also known as the Sea of Japan. According to the Japanese coast guard, the projectile from May fell into the sea.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Tech layoffs: Dell ‘issues’ another job cuts warning, here’s what company said
item.description: Dell is reportedly planning additional job cuts this year to manage costs. The company cited stagnant PC demand and lower profitability of AI-optimised servers. The company expects ongoing headcount reduction through fiscal year ending February 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI TECH DESK

item.title: Communal violence erupts in Karnataka during Ganesha idol immersion
item.description: Tensions erupted in Nagamangala, Karnataka during a Ganesh procession when miscreants threw stones at devotees, sparking a clash. Police used mild force and tear gas to disperse the crowd. Ban orders were issued under CrPC 144, and additional police forces were deployed to regain control. Devotees demand the arrest of those responsible.
item.dc:creator: LAWRENCE MILTON AND SHRINIVASA M

item.title: 70+ citizens with private cover can also avail PMJAY: Centre
item.description: The Union Cabinet has expanded the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY) to cover all senior citizens aged 70 and above. Eligible seniors will get a health cover of up to Rs 5 lakh per year. This move aims to provide accessible and affordable healthcare for elderly citizens across India.
item.dc:creator: DURGESH NANDAN JHA

item.title: Sandip Ghosh was under corruption cloud even before appointment as RG Kar principal
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Mob demanding razing of 'illegal' Shimla mosque clashes with cops, 10 hurt
item.description: Protesters in Shimla's Sanjauli area defied prohibitory orders and clashed with police over an allegedly illegal mosque construction. The confrontation led to injuries and detentions. Himachal Pradesh's public works minister stated that the mosque would be demolished if found illegal by the Shimla municipal commissioner's court. The case has been pending for ten years.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Omar fighting for chair, I’m fighting for people of Kashmir: Er Rashid
item.description: Baramulla MP Sheikh Abdul Rashid, also known as Engineer Rashid, has been released from Tihar jail on interim bail to campaign for the J&K assembly elections. Detained since 2019 under UAPA, he criticized PM Modi's 'naya Kashmir' narrative and vowed to fight for a peaceful resolution of the Kashmir issue. His release has unsettled mainstream parties in Kashmir.
item.dc:creator: VINEET UPADHYAY AND M SALEEM PANDIT

item.title: Biryani row: Administration moves boy to new school, to waive Rs 37k in fees
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi after Pannun backs his remarks on Sikhs
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Impasse on as Bengal junior doctors junk 2nd govt invite for talks
item.dc:creator: SUMATI YENGKHOM AND DEBASHISH KONAR

item.title: 16 fall ill during fitness test for Jharkhand excise constable jobs

item.title: 2013 Patna serial blasts: HC cuts death to 30 years in jail for 4
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Madrassa education against RTE, NCPCR tells SC
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Eye drop licence suspended over safety concern
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: SP shifted after Hindu outfits demand action over Ratlam row
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Bajaj Housing Finance's IPO gets record 3.2 lakh crore demand
item.dc:creator: PARTHA SINHA

item.title: Tata Steel to get £500 million from UK for plant in Wales
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Harris emerges unscathed from debate, dancing around her flip-flops
item.description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump engaged in a heated presidential debate where Harris criticized Trump's previous administration while deflecting questions about her own record. Trump attacked her on issues like inflation and immigration but appeared frustrated by the end. Harris's confident performance led to calls for another debate.
item.dc:creator: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA

item.title: 200 deaths/day, $1.5tn per year: How China is destroying US with fentanyl
item.description: The United States is in the grip of a deadly drug epidemic caused by fentanyl and other opioids, resulting in over 1,500 deaths each week. Fentanyl, mainly sourced from China and Mexico, exacerbates the crisis. This issue has profound economic and social repercussions, necessitating stronger measures against Chinese and Mexican involvement.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Operation Khandara: 2 terrorists killed in J&K’s Kathua, encounter continues
item.description: Two terrorists were killed during an anti-terror operation at Khandara Top in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district. The joint effort by the Army’s Rising Star Corps and J&K Police followed intelligence reports. Earlier, a BSF trooper was injured due to a ceasefire violation by Pakistan along the international border in Jammu’s Akhnoor sector.
item.dc:creator: SANJAY KHAJURIA

item.title: US action on China hits container supply
item.dc:creator: SIDHARTHA

item.title: Hindenburg points to Sebi chief's silence on charges
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Govt plans new chip package, may top first's size of Rs 76k crore
item.dc:creator: PANKAJ DOVAL

item.title: Cong chief Kharge promises five guarantees for J&K
item.description: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge attacked the BJP and Modi government at a rally in Anantnag. He claimed that many BJP members would be jailed if the INDIA bloc had formed a government. Kharge announced five guarantees for Jammu & Kashmir and promised to restore its statehood while criticizing the lack of manufacturing units and vacant government posts.
item.dc:creator: M SALEEM PANDIT

item.title: Watch: Biden wears 'Trump 2024' hat during 9/11 memorial event
item.description: At the 9/11 memorial event in Shanksville, Pennsylvania, President Joe Biden was seen wearing a Trump hat. This occurred after he and Vice President Kamala Harris attended a commemoration at Ground Zero. The incident came amid political tension between Biden and former President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Not Dhoni and Rohit, Gambhir's pick for 'Shahenshah' is...
item.description: At the Delhi Premier League T20, Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir assigned Bollywood movie titles to cricketers like Virat Kohli ('Shahenshah') and Yuvraj Singh ('Badshah'). He also highlighted his positive relationship with Kohli. As India prepares for their Test series against Bangladesh, Kohli's return to the squad is highly anticipated.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: The Multan Mystery: When Dravid left Tendulkar stranded at 194*
item.description: In a 2004 Test match against Pakistan in Multan, Rahul Dravid declared India's innings while Sachin Tendulkar was at 194 not out. The decision aimed to capitalize on the deteriorating pitch but left Tendulkar visibly disappointed. Despite the controversy, India won by an innings and 52 runs, marking their first-ever Test victory on Pakistani soil.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: Watch: PM Modi participates in Ganpati Puja at CJI's house
item.dc:creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: Top 10 things you need to know about Harris vs Trump debate
item.description: Kamala Harris performed strongly in her debate with Donald Trump, receiving endorsements from Taylor Swift and gaining trader confidence. Republicans accused the moderators of bias against Trump. Trump's casual dismissal of Swift's support and the debate's attention on Chinese social media underscored its wide-reaching impact.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: MAGA's wild debate theories: Kamala's 'earphones' to 'witchcraft'
item.description: In the wake of a fiery debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris, MAGA supporters have propagated several conspiracy theories. They allege that Harris used wireless earphones disguised as earrings and engaged in supernatural manipulation. Despite fact-checkers debunking these claims, they continue to gain traction on social media.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: 'On basis of fairness, equality': Yunus says B'desh seeks good ties with India
item.description: Bangladesh's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus has called for fair relations with India and neighboring nations. After assuming office, he initiated talks with India on flood issues and aims to revive Saarc. Yunus announced reforms in six key sectors to enhance democracy and enable the expression of untapped talents within the country.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Mosque row: Himachal tense as protesters clash with police
item.description: In Himachal Pradesh's Sanjauli, protests broke out over an allegedly illegal mosque construction pending since 2010. The Shimla Municipal Corporation's slow pace has angered locals, leading to clashes with police involving lathi-charge and water cannons. Minister Vikramaditya Singh assured that action will be taken based on legal findings, including potential demolition if deemed illegal.
item.dc:creator: TOI NEWS DESK

item.title: ‘3 versus 1’: Why Republicans think Harris vs Trump debate was fixed
item.description: The recent debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris has stirred controversy among Republicans, who claim the moderators were biased. They argue that Trump faced unfair scrutiny while Harris was treated leniently. This has led to accusations of an uneven debate, with Republicans feeling the moderators missed opportunities to challenge Harris on key issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI WORLD DESK

item.title: Watch: 'Craze of King Babar Azam'
item.description: Pakistan's white-ball captain Babar Azam recently showcased his humility during a training session for the Champions One-Day 2024. A fan bypassed security to meet him, and Babar responded warmly, inviting the fan for a chat and photo. This interaction, captured in a viral video, has added excitement to the upcoming tournament.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: When Taylor Swift flaunted her customized $850 Chiefs jacket
item.description: In January 2024, Taylor Swift and NFL star Travis Kelce remained in the spotlight as they welcomed the New Year. Swift attended the Kansas City Chiefs' Week 17 game against the Cincinnati Bengals, donning a custom-made Chiefs varsity jacket. Their relationship continues to captivate fans across both music and sports worlds.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK

item.title: The untold story of Ganguly’s Test debut
item.description: Navjot Singh Sidhu's unexpected departure from India's 1996 England tour after a disagreement with captain Mohammad Azharuddin led to Sourav Ganguly's Test debut. Seizing the chance, the left-handed batter Ganguly scored centuries in his first two matches, beginning a notable career and eventually becoming one of India's most successful captains.
item.dc:creator: TOI SPORTS DESK
